speaker: Owner's Office
lines: Ledgers line the wall like well-behaved bricks.
A small crown sits in a drawer that is only locked when watched.
A map of the city uses spills and burned rings for landmarks.
On a shelf, a stein sweats without being filled.
The owner is nowhere. His chair keeps his shape out of loyalty.
Under the desk, a trapdoor memorizes your weight.
On the desk, three coins; one real, one wood, one that insists on being a moon.
On the door, a hook for a sign that can only read 'Closed' no matter the ink.

choices.text: Pocket the wood coin and leave.

give_item.name: Wood Coin
give_item.description: Buys luck in places that need it

choices.text: Open the trapdoor and trust your ankles.
